comment.author: 67127882@N07
comment._content: The Hehe people assembled at Kalenga, Iringa District, on the occasion of the ceremonial return by the Governor, Sir Edward Twining, on 9 June 1954 of the skull of the Hehe warrior chief Mkwawa who was killed after a battle with the Germans in 1898. The white-turbaned figure by the tree in the centre is the Hehe Chief Adam Sapi Mkwawa. The building on the right is the specially built Mausoleum/Museum where the skull is kept.
